description: We will be studying a series of books and their cinematic adaptations, considering first the texts in autonomous, literary terms, and then their transformation into audio-visual spectacles. Time will be spent on theories of adaptation--a study which will embrace a wide range of critical methodologies, including semiotics, structuralism, feminism, psychoanalysis, postmodernism, and ideological criticism. In most cases we will devote a week to developing a literary reading of the work, and then a week to comparative study of text and film, after the out-of-class screening, making extensive use of video clips to do close visual analysis of scenes in the light of their corresponding textual sources. The course will be conducted as a seminar.
name: LITERATURE INTO FILM
